result.execSummary:
The defendant April N Kincaid was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Alter Price (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Straight time.  Sentence credit for 7 days credit if revoked.
Concurrent with: Case 15CM1720.

miscConds.notes: Restitution in the amount of $61.93 to be paid to TJ Max.  Bail applied to restitution.  Paid in full.

No contact with any TJ Max stores in the State of Wisconsin.
Must not commit any retail theft.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Bail applied to costs.  Remainder of costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

timeConds.notes: Straight time, STAYED for use at Agent's discretion.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant April N Kincaid in court with attorney Paul S. Crawford.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads no contest to Count #1 of Amended Information. Court finds the defendant guilty of Count #1. State makes recommendations. Atty. Crawford makes statements. Defendant makes statements.

The Court Orders the Following: Count #1

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

45 Days Jail with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 7 days if revoked).  STAYED. Concurrent to Case #15CM1720.

Term of Probation: 1 Year (Can be transferred to Milwaukee County)

Conditions of Probation:

-Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
	
-No contact with any TJ Max stores in the state of Wisconsin.

-Must not commit any retail theft.	

Condition Time: 5 days Jail. STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion

Restitution: $61.93  to be paid to TJ MAX to be paid as a condition of probation. 

COSTS:  $253.00 to be paid as a condition of probation ($250.00 Cash Bail to be applied.)
